intro: Psychrogeton persicus, commonly known as the Persian coldweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Iran and Afghanistan. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, narrow leaves. It produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typical of the daisy family. Psychrogeton persicus is adapted to cold and arid environments, often found in rocky soils at high altitudes.
